--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "bergmark_d" <bergmark@C...>
wrote:
> 
> Not necessary to finish the crawl first and then examine the pages;
> you can write a processor that examines the pages on the fly, and
> continue to crawl only from pages of interest, or only write out 
> pages of interest.  To do this, you must parse the HTML, PDF, etc.
> on the fly.  (I have code examples if you want to see how; maybe 
> this should be a section in the user manual for Heritrix).  bergmark_d

This is what I want to do.  Let's say I find an image archive of
10,000 pages, or an article archive with 50,000 articles.  It would be
easy to triage this to just a few hundred pages by simple search
criteria.  I would rather just download those few hundred to begin
with rather than grab zillions of pages and post process them.

If I could see how you wrote such a module -- particularly how you get
it to work with heretrix, that would be wonderful.  I can write a
parser.  I don't have a clue as to how to make it work with heretrix.

It would be extraordinarily useful to have a short tutorial on how to
write modules/filters/whatever for heretrix (I'm still not sure
whether this would be a "filter" or "module" or what).

Thanks!

billo
